website_summaries.verdict: The ANC23s are our new favourite headphones at this point, with excellent sound and a noise-cancelling feature you don't often find at this price.
cons: QuietPoint box heavy enough to tug buds from your ears

customer_reviews.title: Must have for planes
customer_reviews.text: I love these and don't understand the bad reviews. I even got a pair for my hubby. One battery lasts multiple trans-pacific flights. I love how compact they are and that they use a regular AAA battery (Which you can put a spare one of in the included pouch) instead of having to charge a battery that may die on you. The plug adapter for the two-prong earphone jacks on some planes is great. Are they as good as Bose full headphones for noise canceling? No. But they do make a HUGE difference on those long flights. Note - if using as normal headphones, the sound will not be as good as when you put on the noise canceling feature.
customer_reviews.author: Diplowhat

customer_reviews.title: A good buy
customer_reviews.text: These work far better than I expected. The noise masking is reasonably good, probably about as much as can be expected with earbuds. They are not comparable with Bose over the ear units, but neither is the cost. One aspect that I really like is that they will work, sans noise cancelling feature, without power. If you ever fly witout a spare battery you will understand how this is useful. Battery life is good. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: kosraedan

customer_reviews.title: Great option for the budget conscious
customer_reviews.text: I didn't wanna shell out 5x the money for the Bose ones so decided to buy these instead. They do cancel some noise out and definitely make the flights more enjoyable but as soon as I can bring myself to shell out $250 I'll get the Bose. In the meantime this will do and I have no regrets. The foam tips might cancel more of the noise out but hurt my ears way too much so I only tested them with the silicone tips. I have very small ear canals.
customer_reviews.author: Lilly

customer_reviews.title: Quality Control lacking
customer_reviews.text: This was my second purchase; satisfied with the first set to the extent that when I damaged it I came back to replace it with a second set. However, the noise cancelling unit developed a short a few weeks ago, and I just passed out of the return window. So I'm stuck with a product that is approximately 2 months old. Not happy with the quality control. Even though it's inexpensive, I resent the fact I'll now have to go shopping for another set.
customer_reviews.author: Panta Gruel

customer_reviews.title: Great for travel, awkward for everyday use.
customer_reviews.text: They're OK - I use them on the plane, and they're reasonably good for blocking out ambient airplane noise, and comfortable enough to wear for extended periods, and the batteries seem to last forever. I can't use them for walking around though. The placement of the battery pack is odd. The pack has two AAA batteries, so it's e=heavy enough that it will pull the buds out of your ears. The problem is that the pack is placed too far from the ear buds to clip onto sometime like your collar or breast pocket, and too far from the jack to clip onto the pock where you have your phone/audio device.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Paul

customer_reviews.title: Work well, but flimsy wires awkwardly placed..
customer_reviews.text: These work great, but they are awkward to store and set up. The controller is in middle with wires coming out either end. Wires are not easy to wrap or store without danger of damaging. I can see that a wire will come loose or break in a short time, even though I'm very careful with such things. There's a little bag for storage, but that doesn't help with the wires-every-which-way issue. The wires are also pretty flimsy. I use them at the gym to blot out all the loud noises of machines and people not using inside voices. Perfect for that.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn J. Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Not the best, but excellent value
customer_reviews.text: I have Samsung ANC earbuds that cost about $170. This one costs under $40. The sound quality is certainly not as good and the noise cancelling is not as good either-- it lets more noise in. But then, it costs less than 1/4 the price of my Samsung earbuds! So I use this when I am doing yard work and messy activities that can dirty and ruin these ear buds and save my Samsung for air travels etc. For the price and value, I certainly give it a five star. However, if cost is not an issue, then you should consider a better albeit pricier alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin C

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had bought these sooner
customer_reviews.text: Tremendous value for price. Are they as good as the expensive ones? Does it matter? I prefer in-ear headphones and the noise cancellation on these is perfectly adequate. The first time I wore them I was watching a movie and could actually hear everything. I looked around because I thought the background noise in the movie was actually coming from somewhere around me. It's also worth noting that I'm a private pilot and have extensive experience with real aviation headsets, the ones that $1000 and have advanced active noise cancellation. These do not have not that level of sophistication but work well and again, for the price, you just can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Adams

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Did not work right out of the box. A near complete mute of sound coming from the source almost as if it was working in reverse. A big disappointment considering the unit I purchased several years ago still works but the wires are just about worn out. Have to say DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT it does not deserve one star. Now I have the added inconvenience of sending this piece of junk back. Just hope I get a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Florida

customer_reviews.title: Good Headphones
customer_reviews.text: These are headphones, nothing more. ANC works on a airplane. Regular headphone jack, not wireless. AAA battery. I bought 2 pairs many years ago. 1 stopped working after 3-4 years, long time. Other pair still works. I used these on many long flights, A-380's, 747's, 777's. The ANC works for noise that repeats. Not for snoring loud voices and that sort of thing. I've tried many cheap wireless earbuds, none have worked, none. Bose is the only answer for loud noises. I just don't want to pay 300.
customer_reviews.author: David A. Goldstein

customer_reviews.title: Great for flying
customer_reviews.text: Just finished 17 hours of flying with these and it was seriously fantastic. There was a high pitched noise that sounded like wind/air that was NOT cancelled, but it was still miles better than nothing. Slept easier and landed much more refreshed. Makes me curious if the big cans can block even more, but I travel light so that's why I opted for these. I'm not an audiophile so no idea if the sound is good. About as expected for something over $20.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!!!  I HIGHLY recommend these, no need to pay for Bose!!!
customer_reviews.text: I always thought this noise canceling stuff was full of crap be honest!!! But I listen to lectures while I mow the yard. I have ear muffs to kill the sound a good bit and wear the ear phone under them. This had always worked pretty well, but I decided to try this. WOOOOW!!! The difference between when the noise cancelation is turned on vs off was unbelievable!!! Normally I can hear enough to know if I'm overloading the engine and need to slow down, but with these on I can barely hear anything other than the lecture I'm listening to!!! Even IF a $200 pair would work better, why pay the money?!?!? For my situation, these are perfect!!!
customer_reviews.author: D. Grubbs

customer_reviews.title: Poor Wire Insulation
customer_reviews.text: While the noise cancelling on these is actually good, they have a major flaw in that any time the wire moves or brushes up against something it amplifies the sound of it and sends it to the earbuds. Not sure why. It's almost like there isn't enough insulation on the wires between the control unit and the ear pieces. It's fine if you stay 100% perfectly still, but if you move it is so annoying. I would never wear these while walking or moving, but I'm hoping they're okay for a flight where I'm relatively stationary. I would recommend spending the money on something nicer.
customer_reviews.author: Marecek

customer_reviews.title: Very effective for the money
customer_reviews.text: Took these on an international flight. Very effective for quieting noise from the plane engines and other ambient noise. As with other noise canceling earbuds and even headphones, including Bose, that I have tried, they will not completely eliminate all outside noise. However, these earbuds work extremely well to quiet outside noise even to the point you must remove them for a conversation with the person sitting next to you.
customer_reviews.author: Pastjoe

customer_reviews.title: Get these if you travel
customer_reviews.text: I travel quite a bit and really like these headphones for that purpose. I have used them on both jet and propeller airplanes and they give a very noticeable reduction in engine and air noise. Using batteries I can buy anywhere and having adapters for different jacks were also nice touches. I have compared them to an older pair of around the ear Bose and although not quite as good they are probably 85-95% of the way there. If these fail I'll buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Eugene Swank

customer_reviews.title: These are good!
customer_reviews.text: Upon receipt, they were very hard to hear, to the point that I thought I received a defective set. The I remembered they have a volume control, which was set turned all the way down. DUH! Upon turning them up, THESE ARE QUITE LOUD! It seems the control box has some amplification built in (about 10dB I would say). They sound VERY good. I have not had a situation to judge the noise cancellation yet, but that appears to work in my limited testing. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A esential element of my travel tech
customer_reviews.text: Pop these in, power them up, place noise cancelling cans on top. Power them up. And the world disappears. That crying baby in the row behind you is a meaningless nothing in the bacground. Turn on some white noise or rain sounds and its sleepy time on the flight.
customer_reviews.author: Serendipity

customer_reviews.title: Excellent--for the price point
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these for almost four years. My husband has been using his for almost two. We both love them. Are they Bose quality? No. Do they cost hundreds of dollars? No. However, the noise cancellation is good enough to tone down the chaos of a busy grocery store. They may not transport you to the land of audiophile bliss, but they will help you keep your sanity. And, that's pretty good :).
customer_reviews.author: Valerie Martin

customer_reviews.title: Headphones
customer_reviews.text: I got these for travel. Noise-cancelling is one of those things that doesn't work great but is way better than nothing. Getting on a plane and turning these things on feels like the really annoying noises (not the kid behind you) get filtered out. Sound quality is okay - earbuds aren't great speakers, but for earbuds they're good enough. I've had them for almost 2 years now and use them from time to time when I travel or want to tune things out, and they work great.
customer_reviews.author: nadler369

customer_reviews.title: Very quiet and comfortable budget noise reducing ear-plugs
customer_reviews.text: Good noise reduction, used them on overseas flights, in a somewhat noisy hotel room, etc. My wife slept with them in both on the planes and in the hotel room - they are very comfortable, unlike ear plugs. They are not quite as quiet as the Bose QuietComfort 20, but tthey are still very good and offer good audio playback quality. and are comparable to my Sony noise cancelling headphones from a decade ago (which in the end simply wore out). If your budget is tight or want to put your money elsewhere, buy these, otherwise buy the Bose QC20 ear-plugs.
customer_reviews.author: Carrell R. Killebrew

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound, No Noise
customer_reviews.text: I bought the noise-cancelling earbuds for long plane flights, but find it works great in any noisy environment. The earpiece is well designed to fit snugly into the ear to seal out noise and to stay put. It operates on a standard AAA battery with a long duration. It also works as a standard headset if the battery is dead. My only complaint is the connection cord is a bit short.
customer_reviews.author: John H

customer_reviews.title: Cheap build quality... but it works and I'm satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I bought this headset for a recent trip from the US to Asia via Europe. The build quality is not great: in-between the cheap-o airline headsets and the headsets included with Samsung Galaxy phones. Yes... the stock Samsung headsets are better. But these Audio-Technica headsets work very well in drastically reducing the background airplane noise. And they fit very comfortably in my ear. Given the low price, I'm very satisfied with this purchase. Also, a main consideration for me was the 60 hour battery life. I like the fact that I can place a rechargeable AAA battery in it.
customer_reviews.author: Phoenix Rising

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Sound Quality and good seller experience
customer_reviews.text: Third set of head phones and they are still a great value for $37. The first set I unintentionally mangled and the second set for my spouse still works well years later. They do actively reduce ambient noise such as plane noise, clothes dryer noise, fan noise, etc. Set your expectations appropriately as they will not perform the same as a $500 set of noise cancelling headphones. Regarding the seller, the experience was great. Arrived on time and performed as expected. Perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Very good noise reduction on an airplane -- inconsistent elsewhere?
customer_reviews.text: Odd experience. I tried these at home -- turned noise-cancel on/off. Negligible noise reduction. Flew cross-country and tried again. Pretty darned good noise reduction. Not great, but very good. For comparison, I bought a set of Bose QC-20's for the same trip. Yes, Bose noise reduction is better. But the earpiece isolation wasn't as good (at least for me). I returned the Bose and I'll keep these. Also, based on user comments, I bought the Square Trade 4-year warranty. Here's hoping....................
customer_reviews.author: DaveFlyer

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding product for the price
customer_reviews.text: The noise reduction is excellent for reducing engine noise during flights, while allowing announcements from the crew to be heard. I find that it also allows you to keep the overall volume of music lower because you're not trying to compensate for outside noise. As a result, damage to hearing is likely to be reduced. I use them daily at the gym, which is noisy with music/televisions/gym equipment, and the noise is drastically reduced. A single AAA alkaline battery lasts a very long time. I have been using the same AAA battery for several weeks of hour long workouts four times per week. I would estimate that I've used the same battery for over 20 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Adomshick

customer_reviews.title: Work well, excellent value
customer_reviews.text: Do they work as well as "over the ear" headphones at cancelling external noise? Unfortunately, no. They are about 100 times more comfortable, though, so there's that. However, they do cancel a decent amount of "ambient" noise, for example, the rumble of a train. Recently went on a six hour train ride, and they did a very nice job of limiting much of that noise. What they won't do, unfortunately, is totally block out annoying people yapping,although it does make it much more tolerable. They also work nicely as regular headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Decent sound cancelling, good fit, good audio quality.
customer_reviews.text: I've had mine for years. I now use them while mowing the lawn and in my shop. They cut the ambient engine/drill/sander noise considerably and let me listen to my tunes. Battery life is insane. Fit is good. They aren't IPX rated so my usage will probably kill them, one day. They don't have a microphone, which is why they are now my home/shop pair, while I look to buy something wireless.
customer_reviews.author: TX Aggie PM

customer_reviews.title: Great inexpensive alternative for noise canceling earbuds.
customer_reviews.text: If you have lots of spare cash and want the ultimate in sound and noise canceling, go ahead and buy the Bose, but if you want a low cost but very effective alternative, these ear buds are for you. I've tried them in several enviroments, including noisy regional jets, and they significantly reduce repetitive noise and yes, they sound great. Oh and they're comfortable. Another plus is that they still play music when the battery dies, unlike the Beats I have. The only thing I can fault is that there is no mute button so you can talk to the flight attendant when they come by.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Swan

customer_reviews.title: A very nice pair of noise cancellers-I Have already noticed Quite A ...
customer_reviews.text: A very nice pair of noise cancellers-I Have already noticed Quite A Difference Between my Last Pair,where,it seemed That Quite A Bit of extremely egregious noise,somehow still got into my ears,in spite of the fact That I was using Them,at Top volume!! But,with These,it seems That far Less of the types of noise,that I REALLY can't stand,is getting in,which is GREAT!!!! I am really Quite Satisfied With Them,so far! They were a Little more exspensive,but I am willing to sometimes pay a little bit more,if it means higher Quality. A good deal,all around. I would recommend These to anybody,who is hyper-sensitive to many different kinds of noise,and feel they badly need something to help block it out.
customer_reviews.author: Yukon Jack

customer_reviews.title: Great earbuds for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is my first pair of noise-canceling earbuds. I like them very much - they fit my ears well and have a good seal. The noise canceling works well, although less effective than headphones that cover the ear. I find headphones uncomfortable. I got earbuds instead of headphones so that I could sleep while traveling, listening to music, meditations, etc. Like other reviews, I think the battery pack is located in a weird place and is heavy for it's size. I believe these are an excellent value for the price. I recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Mary K.

customer_reviews.title: Sonic Bliss
customer_reviews.text: Design's a little clunky- the control switch box could've been streamlined a lot better, ala Panasonic's models, but the ANC is great and I like the having added volume control dial. Only real drawback is the cord length; the plug runs kinda short, especially for a taller person like me. Otherwise, they're a great set of ANC earbuds- you definitely get your money's worth with them!
customer_reviews.author: John Green, NCGBT

customer_reviews.title: Glad I got these.
customer_reviews.text: These are great. I am a student so I can't afford some of the pricier options. These do the trick. It blocks the air conditioner noise we have at school. They are very comfortable and battery life has been great. For $37, I don't think these can be beat. I haven't compared these to the Bose active noise cancelling ear buds, but I have tried on the Bose QC35. In my opinion, the Bose over the ear headphones are better, but you are also getting some passive noise cancellation with the over-the-ear style headphones - not a fair comparison in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Still going strong after 3 years
customer_reviews.text: I had it for 2 years and 11 months now, and it is still going strong after using it almost daily and taking it to many trips. Plastic clip has lost a small chunk of it but other than that it is holding up remarkably well. Noise cancel Switch is intact, wires are not damaged at all, and most of all the noise cancelling function is working just as well as when I bought it. Recently i tried other models of noise cancelling earbuds but they don't seem to be that much better than this unit. Very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: CL

customer_reviews.title: OK....not great
customer_reviews.text: For the price point, not bad. I would say that maybe about 50% of extraneous noise was actually masked. I ended up "gifting" them to my son who thought they were great for his use. He often walks with them in, mows the lawn, etc and finds them to be comfortable and helps block out noise. I ended up springing for a more expensive set and am VERY happy with them
customer_reviews.author: Barb B.

customer_reviews.title: They function fine as ear buds
customer_reviews.text: The foam earbuds included seem to block out more noise than normal rubber earbuds, but I don't notice any actual sound cancelling between turning the little box on or off. Turning it on makes the audio louder, but doesn't seem to actually cancel out any sound (and I could just turn the volume up if that was what I was looking for.) I can still hear my coworkers from across the office eating, whistling, drumming on desks - everything I'm trying to block out, unless I crack up the sound so loud that I worry about ear damage. They function fine as ear buds, but don't seem to have any actual noise cancelling.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Quigley

customer_reviews.title: Great Value and Sound for Noise Canceling Headphones
customer_reviews.text: I travel for business every week and found that the noise of plane rides can be made much more comfortable with active noise canceling headphones. I shopped around and found that these Audio-Technica headphones offer great noise reduction and sound for a fraction of the price compared to Bose and other premium brands. Audio technica is known for their sound and their noise canceling tech is almost up to par. The only reason I deducted a star is because the pair I previously owned crapped out after 7 months. Not bad for headphones, but still pretty crapped for a product that costs $55.
customer_reviews.author: DallasTrek

customer_reviews.title: Wow. 6hese really do block out outside noise to an extent!
customer_reviews.text: I've never had actual noise canceling headphones that required a battery and truly muted outside noise. Wow. They work really well! I wish i'd had them all those years raising teething newborns and screaming or screeching children in the home- silence =blissful peace. (I'm joking- 🙃 - well, sorta! Lol
customer_reviews.author: GeorgiaPeach

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and convenient
customer_reviews.text: I've bought those earbuds about two years ago and use them daily. Still working fine. Sound quality is good. Noise cancellation is acceptable - not 100%, but good enough to be important feature for me. I use it on the commuter train and subway. Big difference with regular not noise cancelling earbuds. Single rechargeable battery lasts more than a week for me (at least 15 hours).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No bass.
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t flown with these yet, which is my primary reason for buying them (I have over the ear AT’s with noise reduction that are awesome, but I’m looking to reduce bulk when traveling). I can hear a certain amount of ambient noise cut out when switching them on, but nothing significant. Airplane test will be everything for me. I can say that they have almost zero appreciable bass to the sound. Doesn’t matter what genre I try, just no good bass. My regular phone earbuds have better tonal qualities. So far the verdict is still out on these, but so far I’m not impressed.
customer_reviews.author: CP

customer_reviews.title: Nice Headset
customer_reviews.text: I use this for transcription work and am extremely pleased with the sound quality with and without the boost function on. It does a really nice job. The cord is not too long - just long enough to sit comfortable on my desktop out of the way of typing. Comfortable ear fit, for what it's worth, too.
customer_reviews.author: Terri Asbury

customer_reviews.title: No sound from the earbuds.
customer_reviews.text: The product did not work - I literally got no sound out of the earbuds even when I changed batteries or changed devices. The product was not sealed, so I'm questioning if this was a new product or one that had been sold and returned. I'm disappointed and will try a higher end earbuds. I appreciate Amazons return policy when there are defective products.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... Panasonic RP-HC56 earphones for 5 years and I was sad when the turn on button broke
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the Panasonic RP-HC56 earphones for 5 years and I was sad when the turn on button broke. So, I purchased the Audio-Technica and frankly, compared to the Panasonic (3x the price) it is not so good. One thing I dislike is that I have to clip the device on my waist compared to the collar of my shirt with the Panasonic. My advice: if you are looking for good noise-cancelling, try to find some of the more expensive ones but at a discounted price. Try stores like B&H photo or other digital stores.
customer_reviews.author: Country_girl

customer_reviews.title: These are great for my helmet
customer_reviews.text: Sounds great. I wear with a new fullface motorcycle helmet. The noise cancelling module works damn good. Only thing is if you sing along in the helmet, it tries to cancel your voice. Quality of audio is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY for Iphone or Ipad
customer_reviews.text: DON'T BUY for IPHONE/IPAD. Item does not work with my iphone or ipad. The sound is so low (with volume all the way up on my device) that I can just barely hear noise coming out of the ear piece when there is no other noise. Not able to hear at all on the airplane, which is why I bought it. Not able to return, so it was a complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Gail H.

customer_reviews.title: Great value at this price point or even a bit ...
customer_reviews.text: Great value at this price point or even a bit higher. The noise canceling isn't all that different than over-ear Sonys or Bose that I've owned. This is much more compact for short trips and even running. The earbud design is extremely clever with the fore-housing before the earbud fitting snugly in one's convex ear space behind one's actual ear canal. It's snug but not jammed at all like some passive-canceling foam buds that get tiresome after awhile. I've worn these on multiple overnight flights without any ear fatigue.
customer_reviews.author: M. Irwin

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes after reading a lot of reviews, but I really don't like the build quality, sound or noise cancelling (so all the reasons for buying it). The wires seem pretty thin and doesn't really feel like it will last very long. The sound is OK, but when the noise cancellation is on, there is constant hiss. But it does seem to have a long battery life.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: great price but poor noise cancelling
customer_reviews.text: I am a big fan of audio technical. A little disappointment that it doesn't work out for me. Let's be honest, this product does not cancel the ambient noise as expected. Plus, the sound quality is mediocre. The only merits are that it's comfortable to wear, and the price is affordable (after all it's released in 2011). But if you're looking for something of value and your budget is really tight, you could give a try. It doesn't hurt, right? Good luck.
customer_reviews.author: linkinsean

customer_reviews.title: An absolutely blessing for my flights
customer_reviews.text: Once you try ACTIVE noise cancelling, you're hooked. These earbuds only need a single AAA battery and they knocked out so much ambient drone and noise from my flights and even at home! And they're priced well enough that you're not spending a ludicrous amount. These aren't my daily earbuds but when I come across any opportunity that warrants noise cancellation, I'm ready with these!
customer_reviews.author: Ruben Aponte

customer_reviews.title: needing easy noise-canceling headphones
customer_reviews.text: as a layperson, needing easy noise-canceling headphones, these were perfect. on my flight from paris, i didn't hear the airplane engines at all and the ear buds didn't hurt like other buds i've tried. they didn't fatigue my ears either. having recently bought my son a pair of bose headphones, these from audio-technica were comparable in my book. all that was required is a triple a battery so easy peasy lemon squeezy...
customer_reviews.author: Sister Fancypants

customer_reviews.title: Great, affordable earbuds with small form factor
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had two sets of these earbuds. One I lost and the second one lasted for three years before it stopped working. I use them for plane travel. I think the noise cancellation is good, sound quality is great; small form factor that fits easily in my purse. I’ll be buying a third set.
customer_reviews.author: Urbancocoa

customer_reviews.title: Great noise cancelling earbuds for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I really like these noise cancelling earbuds, especially for the price. Yes, you can purchase Bose earbuds, and they will sound a bit better, but I couldn't justify the price difference. I use these Audio-Technica earbuds mostly on planes. It does a good job at squashing the airplane background noise. The batteries last a good amount of time. Has a built-in volume control and on-off switch, so you don't need to keep adjusting the volume from your source (e.g., phone, iPod, iPad). Because the price is reasonable, I won't be too crushed if I lose or break this.
customer_reviews.author: MEDROS

customer_reviews.title: Sound isolation is fine. I am not thrilled with the length of ...
customer_reviews.text: This was my second set of these, Sound isolation is fine. I am not thrilled with the length of the cable for these. I am not tall by any means, 5'6", and when standing, the cord from the control box to the headphones doesn't allow for any slack if you want to use the clip on say your belt, or waist. The only way these aren't too short with the cable is when sitting down. I am just going to give this set to my kids to use, as it is super annoying having the control box come unhooked, or the earbuds fall out, while mowing or any other standing activity.
customer_reviews.author: mike hontz

customer_reviews.title: Failed even before an opinion could be formed
customer_reviews.text: After a half hour of testing late one evening, the results of the noise cancellation were varied. I decided to put them away until I could hear how they work in a conversational setting but, the next day--despite the battery reading full--they failed to work at all. Refund was prompt though.
customer_reviews.author: rongedagain

customer_reviews.title: Good Cancellation, Poor Isolation
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good cancellation but none of the the earbuds particularly fit my ears and don't do a vary good job of isolation. Isolation being how well it reduces noise when the active circuit is off. I had a moderately priced pair of Sony that didn't do quite as good a job of cancellation but did a much better job of isolation. Your ears may be different though, and get a better fit.
customer_reviews.author: James S.

customer_reviews.title: I bought these for my ex boyfriend who has a ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my ex boyfriend who has a rare condition called misophonia. This really allowed him to sit in class without getting frustrated and feeling pain from all the sniffling. However since he never takes earphones they only lasted a couple months but still, if you have misophonia, here is some temporary relief for you!
customer_reviews.author: Amy Saldivar

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work pretty well
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to wear on long rides on my motorcycle in the hopes it would diminish wind noise. Haven't gotten to try it on a ride yet but I have used it around the house. Sound is decent and the noise reduction is impressive for $35. I bought the Bose noise reduction ear phones for my wife and these are pretty darn close in noise reduction. The Bose certainly aren't $200+ better.
customer_reviews.author: J. Jones

customer_reviews.title: A steal for $35
customer_reviews.text: Likes: Cancels a large amount of low frequency (i.e. bus engine) but doesn’t cancel enough to mute bus announcements Around a month and a half worth of 1 hour each way bus rides to and from work Dislikes: A bit uncomfortable at first but I got used to it quickly Doesn’t cancel 90% of all noise, it cancels 90% of consistent low frequency noise (i.e. bus engine); will not cancel much if walking on busy streets Overall: Good budget noise cancelling earphones if you’re only planning on wearing them for a short period of time (i.e. 1-2 hour(s) bus ride to work) and then taking them off; not ideal for long term wearing (i.e. 2+ hours)
customer_reviews.author: Keenan Chu

customer_reviews.title: Saved my hearing
customer_reviews.text: This product is largely responsible for why I still have hearing. I worked around heavy equipment for two years and this is a must when it comes to consistent background noise. It does an excellent job of getting sounds that are constant, such as running fan, truck noise, your nagging wife, etc. The only complaint I have of this product is the part that holds the battery, and my main issue with it is having a hard time fitting it into a space. It hangs kind of in a low spot and tugs the headphones out of your years from time to time. Even when you clip it, it comes off when you're moving around quite a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Adam H.

customer_reviews.title: No noise-cancellation, just amplifies the audio only!
customer_reviews.text: It says it has noise-cancellation, but when I tried it, there was totally no evidence of it at all. When the noise-cancellation button is switched-on, the audio is just simply amplified to a higher level, while the background sound is still ever present and still at the same exact previous volume. Very disappointing experience!
customer_reviews.author: Genghiz

customer_reviews.title: Great for commercial airplanes.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second set. I bought one for my wife so we both had them for 42 hours of flights to Africa and back. Between the two of us, we watched 16 movies. These were great for cutting out the engines drone so we could focus on the movies, and actually hear dialog. One set of batteries lasted the entire trip. These are the best noise-canceling earbuds I have found at this price level.
customer_reviews.author: Dog Lover

customer_reviews.title: An Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: While I bought these earphones to use during air travel, I haven't had the opportunity test them under those conditions yet. However, they have been used for listening to music while mowing the lawn - They work great! I was amazed at the difference in the noise level from the mower when I switched the noise cancelling feature on. You can still hear the mower, but the level is now low enough that I can hear the music clearly. Something I wasn't able to do before without cranking the volume way up. While I'm sure that over-the-ear headphones would eliminate even more of the noise, the performance, comfort and cost differential make these earphones a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Terry the unhinged

customer_reviews.title: you call that noise cancellation???
customer_reviews.text: ehh it's more like 2.5. i ride trains and subways in NYC everyday and it hardly cancelled out the environmental noise it claims to cancel. i can imagine it'd do just about nothing on a plane. giving it 2 stars because the sound is still nice and i like the way they are made but really not very happy with the noise cancellation. i bought these because i am tired of wearing gigantic noise cancelling headphones that cover half my head and was hoping to get some great noise cancellation with simply earbuds. i doubting that it's really possible. if anyone has found a pair, please let me know.
customer_reviews.author: cp.

customer_reviews.title: Value leader active noise cancelation headphones with volume control.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these to replace a pair I lost. The newer version is cosmetically improved and the sound qualities are the same. Battery life is only relevant to active noise cancellation. These work as headphones with volume control even when the battery is dead. Price is less than it was 4 years ago. These headphones are a value leader!
customer_reviews.author: Elliott F.

customer_reviews.title: Received with a broken clip
customer_reviews.text: Noticed the clip on the control module was broken right out of the box. Very flimsy material. I don't expect the other side of the clip to last on use. Functionally it appears pretty go and reduces ambient noise to a level that you can turn your music way down and still hear it clearly. Perfect for bike rides. It does not block out non-steady noises such as someone speaking, a doorbell or a car horn. Works great on wind noise. Don't know about battery life yet. Considering returning for an undamaged unit???
customer_reviews.author: Tony M.

customer_reviews.title: so i had to scrounge around my old Sony inserts and now it fits better. Also
customer_reviews.text: Works OK as a regular earbud, Ear inserts are uncomfortable, so i had to scrounge around my old Sony inserts and now it fits better. Also, it doesn't really cancel out all background noise. I can still hear people talking in the food court!
customer_reviews.author: H. Po, DMD

customer_reviews.title: Great noise canceling in a small package.
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect for my uses. They are compact so I can transport them easily on a flight. I have gone through several because they eventually quit working on one side or another, probably from wear. They are not bad to sleep in and I gave them lots of use when I slept during daytime lawnmowers, leaf blowers and barking dogs. No they are not perfect, but along with an audio book or music, they work perfectly. There is a newer version of these. I haven’t felt the need to pay more.
customer_reviews.author: cmccoy

customer_reviews.title: Noise reduction absolutely useless
customer_reviews.text: I have been using noise reduction product for 15 years (because of work I often take intercontinental flights) both In-ear and overhear. I currently use the Bose QuietComfort 20 and having read reviews that said that the noise reduction of these headphones were comparable I decided to buy a couple of headphones for my family. I feel I was scammed, since the noise reduction of both is nothing comparable to the Bose, and actually worse than my 15 years old noise reduction headphones. Returning them to Amazon is not an option since I live in Europe. Do not buy them.
customer_reviews.author: Giuseppe Castagna

customer_reviews.title: They work well in isolating noise and providing enjoyable sound.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to use during a vacation flight. I am happy to report that they worked well. When I first received them it seemed that the only thing the powered setting did was boost the volume, but when applied during the flight the effect was worth the purchase. I was fully able to enjoy the audio from video and music with clarity and good isolation to would be disturbances. It became necessary to keep my eyes open to respond when refreshments etc were offered. I usually take the smallest ear bud covers and the ones that came with this worked fine fir me. I have not yet tried the more hardened small insert covers.
customer_reviews.author: Clark

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and effective
customer_reviews.text: These are true noise-cancelling earphones and a great choice at the price. As a test, I used my deafeningly loud microwave fan on high. Standing right in front of the microwave, putting the earphones in without turning them on cut out some of the noise. But when I switched the phones to noise-cancelling mode (with no music playing), the noise dropped dramatically to a faint hum. I'm sure the Bose noise-cancelling earphones do a better job, but at three times the cost, I don't think the difference would be worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Bob R.

customer_reviews.title: I felt there was almost no noise reduction
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I have too high expectations; I've used both Bose QuietComfort and several aviation noise reduction headsets. These did just about nothing for noise reduction. My "gold standard test" for noise reduction is to turn on the kitchen range fan, stand a couple of feet away with the headset in place, and then turn the noise reduction on. Result with these: Just about no change in the noise. With my over-the-ear headsets, I get tremendous reduction. So...back to Amazon they go!
customer_reviews.author: Larry in FL

customer_reviews.title: If you can't afford Bose...
customer_reviews.text: ... this is a good option. These in the ear buds can't deliver the synthetic silence of high end, noise cancelling headphones like Bose, but for the price they do a great job of reducing the noise of aircraft engines. I use them on every flight and it makes the journey much less tiring. I strongly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: David Olesker

customer_reviews.title: Does not eliminate wind noise.
customer_reviews.text: I have used the Panasonic version of this product for over 5 years and it worked great. Problem is, the Panasonic is no longer available!!! I tried this unit it works on constant noises, but the buffeting sounds of wind that is not consistent is not eliminated at all. Not as good as the old Panasonic model
customer_reviews.author: Quig

customer_reviews.title: Had another set & worked great for travel on airplanes
customer_reviews.text: I have the Bose over ear headphones but are too bulky to carry on flights. I like to travel with these. If you use them enough the wire will fray after a few years but is still a good buy. It does appear these went up in price quite a bit since my first pair a few years ago but so has everything else. I will be more careful how I wrap the wire & store these. Hopefully they will last longer. Can't stand to hear children cry & whine on flights as I don't have any therefore I don't have patience like the parents do
customer_reviews.author: Canya62

customer_reviews.title: Noise cancelling is basically non-existent
customer_reviews.text: I have the Audio-Technica over-ear headphones and I love them. They are as good as the Bose headphones I had previously. Unfortunately, these earbuds are not even close to that kind of noise cancelling. If you sit quietly and really concentrate, you can hear a very slight reduction in background noise but it's not the "Holy Cow!" kind of noise cancelling that the over-ear headphones has. And when you add in music, you can't notice any difference at all. Basically, it just your average earbuds with a bulky battery pack on the chord. I wish I had just taken the $50 and bought a 20 pack of basic earbuds.
customer_reviews.author: SP

customer_reviews.title: Imperfect but impressive at this price
customer_reviews.text: This is no Bose qc20. I own a pair, and these come about 60% of the way in terms of ANC, which is solid. Passive noise isolation isn't particularly strong. Sound quality is solid, no real complaints there. Build quality is on the thin side, but not fragile.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat it for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I use these when flying. My wife has a pair as well. Plus I bought a third pair in case I lose them. That covers it right?
customer_reviews.author: Band Substance

customer_reviews.title: Excellent ambient noise reduction on an airplane
customer_reviews.text: Excellent ambient noise reduction on an airplane. Earbuds are very comfortable and fit nicely (they stay put and I can wear them for hours at a time). Does not have an in-line volume control, which would be nice, and it requires AAA batteries, whereas some units are rechargeable.
customer_reviews.author: ShopperAnnonymous

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: These noise canceling headphones work great for a fraction of the price of the Bose headphones. My wife has a pair of Bose QuiteComfort 15 headphones ($300) and they are great on long flights. I wanted something similar but really did not want to spend another $300. I got the ATH-ANC23 a few days before my next flight. They do a marvelous job at suppressing the airplane engine noise. On the plane I kept switching between these and my wife's Bose and there was no significant difference. Great deal for $50. I have to say that the Bose work better at suppressing voices and TV noise at the house but for engine noise the ATH are great.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Sparky

customer_reviews.title: This product did a great job of quieting the cabin noise in my car
customer_reviews.text: This product did a great job of quieting the cabin noise in my car. I can't wait to try it on flights and when I use my chainsaw. Recommended. (I had a small issue with Amazon delivery. They listed the product as 'delivered - handed to resident', but that was not true! I looked everywhere, but no package. A few hours later it appeared on my doorstep. They certainly didn't hand it to any resident. All good now, I guess, but they ought to take a look at their delivery policy.)
customer_reviews.author: Madt M.

customer_reviews.title: These things are fantastic! They wipe out 90% of the wind and ...
customer_reviews.text: These things are fantastic! They wipe out 90% of the road noise in my small convertible. I can play music at a much lower volume, and still hear transient noises like car horns, conversations and hear the noise a candy wrapper makes while opening it. The only irritation is the cord length. The "control box" is fairly close to the ear buds, so you must clip the box to your shirt. Then the remaining cord is barely long enough to reach my iphone clipped to my dashboard. Minor irritation. Battery life is fantastic. I have over 20 hours on one AAA battery. I like them so much I bought a second pair. I highly recommend these!
customer_reviews.author: Cyclehead

customer_reviews.title: Absolute JUNK
customer_reviews.text: Do not waste your money on this product, i did and i regret it. I had it for less than 3 months with very light use and it has a short in the cord already. the cord that comes out of both ends of the "quiet box" is weak and now i cant hear the voices only the music unless i twist it just right. Anyway....buy something else. the noise elimination is mediocre at best. I gave the seller a chance to make it right before i left this review but they didn't even bother to respond to my email.
customer_reviews.author: Bentliveson

customer_reviews.title: admittedly but these are great for studying in the library or in a mild ...
customer_reviews.text: Price and performance is unbeatable. No matter what brand and how expensive a pair of noise canceling headphones/earbuds is, they will NEVER completely cancel out all noise. I have a $300 pair of Bose Quietcomforts and these Audio Technica Quietpoints. If I could go back in time and avoid spending 3 bills on the Bose I would do it in a heartbeat. The nose canceling is nearly identical for 1/10th of the price. The sound quality on music is subpar, admittedly but these are great for studying in the library or in a mild setting if you have to listen to lectures or what not. I would gladly buy another pair of these in the future.
customer_reviews.author: E.S.

customer_reviews.title: One of the greatest products I have ever purchased!
customer_reviews.text: These earbuds are simply AMAZING. Being able to cancel noise at the flick of a switch is very nice for a pair of $50 earbuds. They sound better than Apple EarPods (if that helps) but not as good as real physical speakers (Harmon Kardon Soundsticks). As far as noise canceling goes...they eliminate 90% of the background noise and muffle everything else. The 'buds themselves have some passive noise canceling in addition to active noise canceling. Noise canceling earbuds in general are amazing and help preserve your hearing by allowing you to listen to music at a lower volume. This particular model will not disappoint you.
customer_reviews.author: JohnnyMichaels7

customer_reviews.title: For the price these work great. I occasionally travel and they work great on ...
customer_reviews.text: For the price these work great. I occasionally travel and they work great on the airplane for eliminating the low frequency hum of the plane. You don't realize how loud the plane is until you can eliminate the sound with just the touch a of a switch. It will not eliminate any voices, which most noise cancelling headphones won't do anyway. They come with multiple ear pieces for a good fit. The battery lasts a long time, but it doesn't give you any warning when its low, so carry an extra AAA battery with you when traveling.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Around AC
customer_reviews.text: Just what I expected. Great service and speedy delivery. Product was a little lacking in my needs, some of the frequencies I was looking to block still came through. Good for the inside noises.
customer_reviews.author: Paul R

customer_reviews.title: Great set, good price
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my wife, who reports that they work great. They replaced a Sony set she had that somehow spent a winter in bushes in Rochester, NY. The Sony set still worked, mostly, but did suffer some damage that made them unsightly, plus lost some insulation at some critical points. Anyway, these did the trick and she uses them frequently on business trips (air and car) as well as around the house.
customer_reviews.author: eDave

customer_reviews.title: Failed after an hour of use
customer_reviews.text: The first pair of headphones developed static in the right ear after one use and I emailed customer support. Audio-Technica's customer support basically put the ownership back on Amazon and said if Amazon doesn't come through, that I could pay to ship it back to Audio-Technica to have them repair it. The second pair of headphones works fine for the money. For the poor product QA, and for the poor customer support, I have downgraded the review to 1 star. I would not recommend buying a product from a company like this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon_Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better off with over the ear noise cancelling earphones.
customer_reviews.text: Not especially great for noise cancellation. Overall good sound and decent noise cancellation (low volume noises). Didn't seem to help too much on latest air travel. Didn't allow clear sounds on tablet and was I unable to hear the dialog of movies on my Samsung tablet.
customer_reviews.author: La T'Ray

customer_reviews.title: Really good Noise cancellation
customer_reviews.text: Amazing sound quality for the price. Not quite to the $300 Bose headphone quality but far better than any other headphones I ever used. I used it to remove all the airplane noise on flights to and from China and since it fit in my ear it was easier to sleep on the flight than the over the ear headphones. I also usually have a hard time hearing the low volume audio from the Aircraft sound systems because of the background noise, but this removes all the background noise and will also amplify the audio.
customer_reviews.author: John Mladenik

customer_reviews.title: They do a great job of blocking out noise
customer_reviews.text: I was looking at getting a pair of $299 pair of BOSE noise cancelling head phones when I decided to try something more economical. I purchased these instead. They do a great job of blocking out noise. I feel they are almost as effective as BOSE at a fraction of the price. They work great on planes and other areas with steady loud noise. I've had mine a few months now. The battery (1 AAA) lasts for weeks and I've only changed the battery 3x since I've had them. I wouldn't hesitate to buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: J in FLA

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: Great noise cancellation that you can definitely notice. Good sound quality and volume (especially on airplane). The only negative I would have is that the batter compartment is large and the cords coming out of it can be damaged easily if you're not careful (this is my second pair of these). Overall these are a high quality option versus the more expensive brand name noise cancelling earbuds.
customer_reviews.author: DWood

customer_reviews.title: Surprised, not in a good way...
customer_reviews.text: After quite a bit of research, I decided to take the chance and bought these headphones over the more expensive Bose line. Sometimes you simply get what you pay for... These arrived and I opened the box with excitement, only to find out they were defective. As soon as I tried to turn on the noise canceling feature, the audio would cut out completely. The "on" light would intermittently turn on, but no audio. I tried three different brand new batteries to the same result. I have returned these and purchased Bose.
customer_reviews.author: Steven M. Lee

customer_reviews.title: I even like to use them for flying because the sounds on ...
customer_reviews.text: I wear these out all the time because I work with them in my ears. I'll run a vacuum and listen to Audible. I even like to use them for flying because the sounds on airplanes raise my anxiety (especially during take-off.) And loud power-tools stress me out so I use these a lot. I've even taken them into movie theaters to drown-out the pre-movie commercials. It doesn't totally block-out the commercials, but it does kill enough of the noise so I can read Kindle in peace or listen to that next book.
customer_reviews.author: Teddy L. Boulden

customer_reviews.title: These little guys are great considering the price
customer_reviews.text: I love these earbuds for the price. I looked at a lot of noise cancelling headphones. I couldn't justify the price for something I was only going to use a handful of times a year (while flying). I am glad I got these. They have gone overseas twice, to Alaska once, and to Pinedale 3 times and I am still on the same set of batteries. They can be used as headphones even when the battery does die. I was really surprised how effective they were at removing the airplanes engine hum. The one draw back is that the bottom half of the cord is a little to short. This makes the clip a little harder to use.
customer_reviews.author: miller

customer_reviews.title: A decent earphone for the price
customer_reviews.text: Pretty nice earphones, good value for money - doesnt have a mic and is just for music. So if you need a complete headset with mic with which you can attend calls - this doesnt cut it. The noise cancellation is good but not great. All in - a very good basic ANC headphone
customer_reviews.author: Venkatesan

customer_reviews.title: Beats the Bose 20i cost/benefit any day
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. Not quite as good as the Bose 20i earbuds, but at 1/4 the price for 90-95% of the same performance these are a great deal. More comfortable to sleep with them in than the Bose are, so that's a bonus and I'm not going to care if they break in a year (6 months for the Bose ones I had...) or I manage to lose them. I would have preferred a hard case rather than the drawstring bag they give you for storage.
customer_reviews.author: Evan M.

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: Wear them everyday at the office - an open air type like Facebook, ect - and do an Awesome job of blocking out noise! Very recommended and advise everyone who wants to hear well and have the ability to "yank" them out at a moment's notice unlike bulky headphones with active noise-canceling. Only cons are requires an AAA battery(non-rechargeable) and AT should offer a slightly upgraded pair. I'm no audiophile but picky and the sound is decent but my etymotic research and monsters sounded a bit better.
customer_reviews.author: wushu

customer_reviews.title: Wow, noise gone...
customer_reviews.text: Quite simply these work and they work very well. I used them on a trip to Australia and they cut down the jet noise by 90% or more the same on an all day train ride. One plane ride was on a small Saab turboprop that was to say the least was excessively noisy. Once again these cut the noise by 90% or better. Bottom line, you can spend a lot more and I do not think get any better results. Buy them you wont be sorry. I did take one other train ride but that train was so quiet I didn't need the headset.
customer_reviews.author: J. P. Price

customer_reviews.title: Excellent alternative to the $200-$300 Bose products
customer_reviews.text: Excellent alternative to the $200-$300 Bose products. About 80-85% as good for a fraction of the cost. Works well to dull the noises in a coffee shop to be able to get into the work "zone." The compact size fits easily into a laptop bag without the bulk of headphones. The comments about the awkward location of the battery/electronics box is true. It can fall off tables unexpectedly and get in the way of paperwork from time to time. It should be located higher up rather than in the middle of the wire. Minor annoyance that keeps it from getting 5 stars, but this is easily overlooked for the price. I would purchase it again or recommend it to others.
customer_reviews.author: Self Analysis

customer_reviews.title: Work Great against jet noise!
customer_reviews.text: When I first got these I put them on with no audio connected while listening to TV, upon turning them on it was surprising how quiet the sound coming from the TV became. This of course is not why I bought them but it was enough for me to keep them and try them on my recent flight over seas. So about the flight, these things worked fantastic on the plane in tuning out the aggravating jet noise. They were so good I had to pull one out of my ear as stewardess service came by so I could hear what they had to say.
customer_reviews.author: Sir Elric

product_meta.title: Audio-Technica ATH-ANC23 QuietPoint Active Noise-Cancelling In-Ear Headphones
product_meta.description: Product Packaging:Standard PackagingATH-ANC23 QuietPoint Active Noise-Cancelling In-Ear Headphones reduce distracting background noise by up to 90% while offering the superior sound that makes Audio-Technica a world-leading pro audio company.
feature_bullets: Reduce distracting background noise by up to 90% while offering superior sound
Engineered to create a comfortable listening environment in areas with high ambient noise
Feature a miniature microphone in each earpiece that picks up ambient noise
Electronics in control box create a noise-cancelling wave that is 180 out of phase with ambient noise-wave acts as noise eraser

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.8 out of 5 stars2,081 ratings3.8 out of 5 stars
